3:51 (radio edit) | label = {{hlist|[[A&M Records|A&M]]|[[will.i.am Music Group|will.i.am]]|[[Interscope Records|Interscope]]}} | writer = {{hlist|[[will.i.am]]|[[apl.de.ap]]|[[Taboo (rapper)|Taboo]]|[[Justin Timberlake]]|[[Printz Board]]|Michael Fratantuno|[[George Pajon]]}} | producer = {{hlist|[[will.i.am]]|Ron Fair}} | prev_title = [[Request + Line]] | prev_year = 2001 | next_title = [[Shut Up (The Black Eyed Peas song)|Shut Up]] | next_year = 2003 | misc = {{External music video|{{Youtube|WpYeekQkAdc|"Where Is the Love?"}}}} }} "'''Where Is the Love?'''" is a song by American hip hop group [[The Black Eyed Peas]]. It was released in June 2003 as the lead single from their third album, ''[[Elephunk]]''. The song was written by [[will.i.am]], [[apl.de.ap]], [[Taboo (rapper)|Taboo]], [[Justin Timberlake]], [[Printz Board]], Michael Fratantuno and [[George Pajon]]. The track features vocals from Timberlake, although he is not officially credited on the single release. It was the group's first song to feature singer [[Fergie (singer)|Fergie]] as an official member. "Where Is the Love?" saw success on radio airplay charts,{{cite web | url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1484775/road-to-the-grammys-the-making-of-black-eyed-peas-where-is-the-love/ | title=Road to the Grammys: The Making of Black Eyed Peas' 'Where Is the Love' | work=MTV News | date=March 2, 2004 | accessdate=September 2, 2016}} peaked at number eight on the US [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]], and topped the charts in Australia, Ireland, and the United Kingdom. It became the biggest-selling single of 2003 in the latter country. The band and Timberlake received two nominations, [[Grammy Award for Record of the Year|Record of the Year]] and [[Grammy Award for Best Rap/Sung Collaboration|Best Rap/Sung Collaboration]], for "Where Is the Love?" at the [[46th Annual Grammy Awards]].{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/topics/g/grammy/2004/nominees/nominees.jhtml |title=2004 Grammy Nominees |publisher=MTV |accessdate=June 21, 2015 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150502134948/http://www.mtv.com/news/topics/g/grammy/2004/nominees/nominees.jhtml |archivedate=May 2, 2015 }} ==Background== Following the commercial failures of their previous albums and singles, there was doubt over whether [[The Black Eyed Peas]] would continue to record together. A&R executive [[Ron Fair]] approached them and suggested a crossover to a more mainstream pop sound. [[will.i.am]] in particular resisted the idea for fear that they would be seen as sellouts. However, after discussions and some writing sessions, the idea was pursued.{{cite web|last=Moss |first=Corey |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1484775/20040203/black_eyed_peas.jhtml |title=Road To The Grammys: The Making Of Black Eyed Peas' 'Where Is The Love' - Music, Celebrity, Artist News |publisher=MTV |date=2004-02-04 |accessdate=2012-01-12}} Shortly after [[Christmas]] 2001, [[will.i.am]] created a loop and a guitar part that he liked. [[apl.de.ap]] and [[Taboo (rapper)|Taboo]] also heard the track and were able to write similar lyrics over it. [[Justin Timberlake]] was introduced to the group by [[Taboo (rapper)|Taboo]], and got a chance to hear the track that will.i.am created. Impressed with the music, Timberlake helped write and sing the chorus. Timberlake was in the midst of promotion of his debut solo album, ''[[Justified (album)|Justified]]'', and his label [[Jive Records]] was concerned about possible overexposure. The Black Eyed Peas were worried about this, as getting some assistance from an established pop star like Timberlake had been the original point of this song. A compromise was reached eventually in which Jive gave clearance for the vocals of Timberlake to be released on the song, but he does not appear in the song's music video nor is he officially credited on the song as an artist. By 2008, the single had sold 954,000 digital copies.{{cite web|last=Grein |first=Paul |url=http://new.music.yahoo.com/blogs/chart_watch/32895/week-ending-april-5-2009-a-prince-beats-a-king-of-pop/ |title=Week Ending April 5, 2009: A Prince Beats A King (Of Pop) | Chart Watch - Yahoo! Music |publisher=New.music.yahoo.com |date=2009-04-08 |accessdate=2012-01-12}} ==Composition== [[File:JustinTimberlakeJune07 crop.jpg|thumb|170px|upright|right|Timberlake co-wrote the song and provided vocals.]] The song was written by [[will.i.am]], [[apl.de.ap]], [[Taboo (rapper)|Taboo]], [[Justin Timberlake]], [[Ron Fair]], [[Printz Board]], [[George Pajon]], Fiona Davies, M. Fratantuno, and J. Curtis, and co-produced by will.i.am and Ron Fair. In this song, [[The Black Eyed Peas]] lament on various worldwide problems. Many issues are discussed, which include but are not limited to [[terrorism]], [[Federal government of the United States|US government]] hypocrisy, [[racism]], [[gang crime]], [[pollution]], war and intolerance. ==Reception== The song was rewarded with nominations at the [[46th Annual Grammy Awards]] in 2004 for [[Record of the Year]] and [[Best Rap/Sung Collaboration]]. The song was the biggest selling single of 2003 in the UK. It was also the 25th best-selling single of the 2000s (decade) in the UK.Radio 1 Chart of the Decade, as presented by [[DJ Nihal]] on December 29, 2009 On May 12, 2013, after 10 years since the song's release, the song re-entered the official UK singles charts at 40, eventually peaking at 35. ==Music video== The music video for "Where Is the Love?" was shot in [[East Los Angeles, California|East Los Angeles]] and features [[The Black Eyed Peas]] and various other people, including various young children, asking the world where the love really is. In the video, [[will.i.am]] and [[Taboo (rapper)|Taboo]] act as a [[soul music]] road duo who use music to tell people what is wrong with the world, [[Fergie (singer)|Fergie]] appears as a peacemaker who places stickers with question marks on them all over the place to ask people where the love is in the world, and [[apl.de.ap]] is a criminal who is arrested for using criminal offences to tell people the truth. [[Justin Timberlake]] does not appear in the video, although several different people are seen mouthing his part. The video is similar to a 2002 British television advertisement for [[T-Mobile]], in which a face of a young baby is presented in various forms around a large city, much like the question mark in this video. The [[Bon Jovi]] music video "[[Have a Nice Day (Bon Jovi song)|Have a Nice Day]]" is also similar to both the advertisement and this video. The video features gameplay footage of the extremely graphic and controversial video game ''[[Postal 2]]'', in which a group of young children are playing the game. This suggests that violence in the media and entertainment industry affects the morals of children. Near the beginning of the video, posters of the video game ''[[Grand Theft Auto: Vice City]]'' are shown. ==Formats and track listings== ; CD single # "Where Is the Love?" – 4:35 ==Personnel== * Arranged by [[Ron Fair]] * Writers – [[will.i.am]], [[Justin Timberlake]], [[Taboo (rapper)|Taboo]], [[apl.de.ap]], [[Printz Board]], Michael Fratantuno, [[George Pajon|George Pajon, Jr.]] *Producers – will.i.am, Ron Fair ==Charts== {{col-begin}} {{col-2}} ===Weekly charts=== {|class="wikitable sortable" !Chart (2003–2004) !Peak

Blige]], [[Sean Combs|Diddy]], [[Cassie Ventura|Cassie]], [[Andra Day]], [[The Game (rapper)|The Game]], [[Tori Kelly]], [[Veronika Bozeman|V. Bozeman]], [[Jessie J]], [[French Montana]], [[DJ Khaled]], [[Usher (singer)|Usher]], [[Nicole Scherzinger]], [[ASAP Rocky]], [[Jaden Smith]] and a 40-member children's choir.{{cite web|url=http://www.ew.com/article/2016/09/01/black-eyed-peas-reunite-update-where-love|title=Black Eyed Peas reunite to update 'Where Is The Love'|work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|date=September 1, 2016|accessdate=September 1, 2016}} All proceeds from the song will go to will.i.am's non-profit foundation, i.am.angel. – the charity funds educational programs and college scholarships.{{cite web | url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/7494764/black-eyed-peas-where-is-the-love-gun-violence-protest | title=Black Eyed Peas Reunite for Anti-Gun Violence Song | work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] | date=August 31, 2016 | accessdate=September 1, 2016}} The Black Eyed Peas partnered with issues-driven media company ATTN and foundation education partner and leading geospatial company Esri for the single release campaign. It was the group's last song to feature singer [[Fergie (singer)|Fergie]]. ===Music video=== An accompanying music video, directed by Michael Jurkovac, also premiered worldwide on [[Apple Music]] that same day and shows appearances by the featured vocalists and many celebrities including [[Connie Britton]], [[Lance Bass]], [[Rosario Dawson]], [[Shailene Woodley]], [[Taye Diggs]], [[Kareem Abdul-Jabbar]], [[Quincy Jones]], [[Olivia Munn]], [[Jhené Aiko]], [[Krewella]], [[Wiz Khalifa]], [[Charlie Carver]], [[Ian Harding]], [[Max Carver]], [[Daniel Sharman]], [[Vanessa Hudgens]], [[Russell Westbrook]], [[Carla Gugino]], [[DJ Khaled]], [[Ben Barnes (actor)|Ben Barnes]], [[Nikki Reed]], [[Jessica Szohr]], [[Snoop Dogg]], [[LL Cool J]], [[Adrianne Palicki]], [[Adrienne Bailon]], [[Kris Jenner]] and [[Kendall Jenner]].{{cite web | url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YsRMoWYGLNA | title=The Black Eyed Peas - #WHERESTHELOVE ft. The World | publisher=[[YouTube]] | accessdate=September 2, 2016}}{{cite web | url=http://www.nrj.fr/artistes/will-i-am/actus/black-eyed-peas-remixe-where-is-the-love-avec-justin-timberlake-usher-340424 | title=Black Eyed Peas remixe "Where Is The Love?" avec Justin Timberlake, Usher... | language=French | publisher=[[NJR]] | date=August 31, 2016 | accessdate=August 31, 2016}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.wheresthelove.com/credits/|title=#WHERESTHELOVE|website=www.wheresthelove.com|access-date=2016-12-26}} Inspired by tragedies, like the [[November 2015 Paris attacks|attacks in Paris]], and in [[2016 Brussels bombings|Brussels]] and [[Orlando nightclub shooting|Orlando]], and police shootings of [[shooting of Philando Castile|Philando Castile]] and [[Alton Sterling]], the Peas saw the relevance of the song and decided it was time to revive the track for a new generation.{{cite web | url=http://www.rap-up.com/2016/08/31/black-eyed-peas-wheres-the-love-2016/ | title=Watch the All-Star Remake of Black Eyed Peas' '#WHERESTHELOVE' | language=English | work=[[Rap-Up]] | date=August 31, 2016 | accessdate=September 1, 2016}} Family members affected by gun violence including ([[Alton Sterling]]'s aunt Sandra, [[Philando Castile]]'s mother Valerie) and police officials (Dallas Police Chief David O.
